data.title: Jools Holland VIP Tickets & Hospitality Packages
data.meta_description: Book official hospitality packages & VIP tickets for Jools Holland's 2024 tour dates at Seat Unique. Guarantee your spot & secure premium seats today!
data.text:
Jools Holland, whose full name is Julian Miles Holland, is an English pianist, bandleader, singer, composer, and television presenter. He was born on January 24, 1958, in London, England.

Holland's career spans several decades and encompasses various accomplishments. He gained popularity as a member of the band Squeeze in the 1970s and 1980s. After leaving the band, he formed his group called Jools Holland's Rhythm and Blues Orchestra in 1987.

Aside from his work as a musician, Holland is also known for his successful television career. He has hosted the music TV show "Later... with Jools Holland" since 1992, which features live performances from a wide range of artists. Holland has collaborated with numerous renowned musicians and has released several albums of his compositions.

Through his passion for music, Jools Holland has become a prominent figure in the music scene, earning him a dedicated fan base and recognition for his contributions to the industry.

Musical Style

Jools Holland's musical style is primarily rooted in rhythm and blues, boogie-woogie, and jazz. His piano playing is characterized by energetic and lively improvisation, often incorporating elements of swing and blues.

Collaborations

Throughout his career, Holland has collaborated with numerous renowned artists from various genres. Some notable collaborations include performances with Eric Clapton, Paul McCartney, Sting, B.B. King, David Gilmour, and many others. These collaborations have further solidified his reputation as a versatile musician.

"Later... with Jools Holland"

Holland has been hosting the acclaimed music program "Later... with Jools Holland" since 1992. The show provides a platform for both established and emerging artists to showcase their talent through live performances. It has become one of the most influential and respected music shows in the United Kingdom.

Awards and Accolades

Jools Holland's contributions to music have been recognized with numerous awards and honours. He has received several BAFTA awards for his work on "Later... with Jools Holland" and was awarded an OBE (Order of the British Empire) for his services to the music industry.

Discography

Holland has released numerous albums throughout his career, both as a solo artist and with his Rhythm and Blues Orchestra. Some notable albums include "Swingin' the Blues, Savin' Up for a Rainy Day," "Small World Big Band," and "Jools and Ruby." These albums feature collaborations with a wide range of artists, showcasing Holland's ability to bring together musicians from different backgrounds.

Jools Holland's Most Popular Songs

1. "What Would I Do Without You" - This soulful track featuring Sam Brown's incredible vocals can be found on Jools Holland's album "Swinging the Blues, Dancing the Ska".

2. "I'm in the Mood for Love" - Jools Holland's rendition of this classic song is highly regarded by fans.

3. "Tuxedo Junction" - Originally popularized by the Glenn Miller Orchestra, Jools Holland has performed a notable version of this jazz standard.

4. "Enjoy Yourself (It's Later Than You Think)" - Jools Holland and his Rhythm and Blues Orchestra often include this catchy tune in their live performances.

5. "Valentine Moon" - A collaboration between Jools Holland and Sam Brown, this song showcases their soulful chemistry.

Jools Holland's Most Popular Albums

1. "Jools Holland's Big Band Rhythm & Blues" by Jools Holland & His Rhythm & Blues Orchestra - This album is often considered one of Jools Holland's best. It features a collection of blues and rhythm & blues tracks, showcasing his infectious piano playing and collaborations with various artists.

2. "Swinging the Blues, Dancing the Ska" by Jools Holland - This album showcases Jools Holland's love for blues and ska music. It includes tracks like "What Would I Do Without You" featuring Sam Brown, which is a fan favourite.

3. "Jools & Ruby" by Jools Holland and Ruby Turner - Released as a duet album, "Jools & Ruby" features the soulful vocals of Ruby Turner alongside Jools Holland's piano skills. It has received positive reviews and is a favourite among fans of both artists.
